article:
Two ships of the United States Navy have borne the name 'USSStrong', in honor of
Rear Admiral James H. Strong (1814â€“1882), who distinguished himself at the
Battle of Mobile Bay.

* The first, ''Strong'' (DD-467), was a ''Fletcher''-class destroyer, launched
  in 1941 and sunk in action in 1943.
* The second, ''Strong'' (DD-758), was an ''Allen M. Sumner''-class destroyer,
  launched in 1944 and struck in 1973.
